{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3346154,"name":"ori","username":"revthunder","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/2bfe46/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-28T13:17:13.210Z","cooked":"

Running a beelink co-proccesor and when adjusting the exposure it doesn’t change,
Only the step between 0.4 to 0.5 is going from pitch black to a single exposure no matter what the slider says.
When assigning auto exposure and removing it the last value that the auto exposure gave is what stays.

Which camera are you using?

We use a OV2311 and see the same issue, along with 0.5-1.4ms having no changes whatsoever.

Ov9782 it doesn’t matter if we are 0.5ms or 100 Ms the exposure is the same

Looks like this is what you need, maybe? Adds support for OV9782's quirks by gautvm · Pull Request #1284 · PhotonVision/photonvision · GitHub

After updating, we still see that 0.5-1.4ms exposures are entirely constant, while 0.4 is pitch black and 1.5 is as bright as the sun. This is with the OV2311 quirk enabled.

We seem to have the same issue, the exposure seems to like rounding to the nearest whole number. It tends to sort itself out if we turn auto exposure on and then off. Not sure why…
